thread.title: Kenya: Kaimenyi Sees Fire As Kenyans Roast Him On Social Media
thread.title_full: Kenya: Kaimenyi Sees Fire As Kenyans Roast Him On Social Media

title: Kenya: Kaimenyi Sees Fire As Kenyans Roast Him On Social Media
text:
Kenya: Pope Francis Will Hold Talks With Uhuru, Meet All Religious Leaders During Visit - State By Ouma Wanzala 
Kenyans on Friday turned to social media to express their disappointment with the government decision to close schools over the ongoing teachers strike. 
The government defended the move saying it was arrived at to protect students, staff, and the property in schools and to allay the worries of parents and guardians. 
Kenyans said closing down schools will not end the stalemate between teachers and their employer --Teachers Service Commission (TSC). 
Trending under #SomeoneTellKaimenyi, most of Kenyans had no kind words for the Education cabinet Secretary. 
One Ben Marete tweeting as ‏@BenMarete posted: "#SomeoneTellKaimenyi education is the key to success, paying teachers their salaries is the key to education, closing schools is a wrong turn." 
Gichuhi ‏tweeting as @pedigreekenyan said: "Today's govt decision to close all schools is rubbing salt into the wound .Aggravating pain Kenyan pupils are facing. #SomeoneTellKaimenyi." 
Abdirisan_Göôñër as ‏@Abdirisan08 said: "Kaimenyi is genius how can you close schools that were never opened #SomeoneTellKaimenyi." 
Henry Kamande as @kamandehn lamented: "He who opens a school door, closes a prison #SomeoneTellKaimenyi it's cheaper to pay teachers than maintain the prisons he has opened today." 
Leon Lidigu ‏posting as @LeonLidigu said: "UhuRuto Gov't has successfully made teaching the ugliest professional around here! #IstandWithKenyanTeachers #SomeoneTellKaimenyi." Kenya
